New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers set a franchise record with their eighth straight win, matching the 1976-77 team's streak.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored a game-high 39 points, including a crucial 3-pointer with 45 seconds left and setting up Jarrett Allen for a layup with 12.2 seconds remaining.
Milwaukee Bucks forward AJ Green made a 52-foot shot at the final buzzer, his seventh 3-pointer of the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland Cavaliers center Jarrett Allen (31) drives to the basket against Milwaukee Bucks forward Bobby Portis (9) during the second half at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse in Cleveland, Ohio.
Milwaukee Bucks played without star Giannis Antetokounmpo (adductor), leading to their sixth consecutive loss.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland Cavaliers equaled a franchise record set in 1976-77 with their eighth straight win.
Milwaukee Bucks struggled without Giannis Antetokounmpo, losing their sixth game in a row.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was highlighted by key performances and a tense finish, with the Cavaliers securing a hard-fought victory.
